climbs.name: Yaborrhea
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, Brandt Allen, Laurel Colella, 11/2000

content.description: Thin dihedral crack right of Yabo Phone Home, with a "helper" crack to its left for the upper section.  Awkward at spots.  Also, there's a precarious loose-looking big block at the top of the dihedral that one might want to not disturb.  MP one star = OK, according to its quality scale.  Overall, not outright terrible, but fairly meh, more so to experience the odd awkwardness.
Up and over an alcove overhang to wrap left and up via off-fingers to tight-hands splitter crack.  On west side of the sprawling Pep Boys formation.  West-facing with morning shade and afternoon sun.
content.location: Obvious descent down the prominent gully by the start, or down shoulder ledges along that back to the base.

content.description: Start above a big boulder.  Follow thin crack up a right-facing dihedral, then up and over a bulge roof.  Small offset cams helpful.
content.location: Walk off up over the top and down the backside, wrapping around past Yabo Phone Home back to base.  Climb is located further in the corridor/alley past Dos Perros Negros.  Best to approach via this way, instead of directly from the road with what looks like much scrambling and bushwhacking.

climbs.name: Yabo Phone Home
climbs.fa: Darryl Nakahira, Mike Waugh, and Kevin Powell, 1983

content.description: This fun, short, well protected route provides a memorable mental challenge.  Twenty years after I climbed it, I can still remember the weird crux sequence.
content.location: A tighter than right-angle dihedral at the left end of the crag (south end).

content.description:
Start up past a right-slanting diagonal to gain a thin flake, then up along the right side of the latter, until arriving at the start of the right-slanting fingertip traverse. Good thin gear up til then. Some marginal thin gear across the traverse. Then a vertical handcrack to the top. Anchor bolts atop adjacent Two Guys On The Wrong Climb to climber's left. FTOJ is on the north face of the northern most section of Pep Boys Crag, visible from the Playhouse/Cathouse pullout. (Note: the route as drawn in Joshua Tree West starts further to climber's right, to

somehow

gain an upper leftward arch marked by an unprotectable hairline seam over lichen covered coarse grains that looks untraveled, which connects only to the midpoint of the above described fingertip traverse, as in one would end up doing only the latter half of that traverse. Probably mis-drawn in that 2006 book.)
content.protection: Thin to 2", gear anchor or traverse to climber's left to anchor bolts atop adjacent Two Guys On The Wrong Climb.

climbs.name: Dos Peros Negros
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Pat Brennan, and Dave Evans

content.description: A pleasant, varied climb (face and lieback).  In older guidebooks, it was named "Manny, Moe, & Jack."
content.location: This route is on the second large piece of rock from the right end of the "formation."

content.description: Follow cracks just right of the arete, until you can reach the arete. Climb up the arete past a couple of bolts, and then do a short traverse on top of the ridge to get to the summit.
content.protection: trad gear (small rack sm to large) and a couple of QDs for the bolts. There may be a fixed pin nesr the top too.
content.location: Backside (SW end) of the Pep Boys Crag. You can get to it from the notch left of Yabo Phone Home, or hike in on the flats from Playhouse/Cat House parking Area.
